content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Really awesome game where it takes a unique twist on the turn-based tactics strategy gameplay. Its art style is beautiful and so does the story which make you part of the characters and the people who you wish to be fighting with you, that is if you followed the story xD. The controls are alright for me using a keyboard and mouse since this is an excellent port from the PS3(Also on the PS4 as a Remastered Edition).The description says what it is basically. Positioning is key here and sometimes there are moments that have hard missions with infinitely respawning enemies until you complete the objective, at the same time there are also easy missions which makes for a nice change of pace. Also, there are HUGE Maps which may take you longer than average to finish and it affects your mission rating. The game still has many things to do during or after the main story, and most of them have replay value.NOTE: Be prepared for grinding, though because of the DLC it actually lightens it if you can get an A rank, plus you get an awesome gun for the scouts in some DLC missions, save for the Ruhm as one of the best weapons in the game.Too bad this was not advertised anywhere. Though there is Valkyria Chronicles 2 and 3 on other platforms, I just hope it gets ported(properly) to the PC in the future.Bought this since 3/21/2016 once I had a job, so yeah I admit I pirated such an awesome game.Rating:Gameplay: 9/10 (Some bugs and glitches encountered but nothing major)Story: 10/10Music: 9/10Graphics: 10/10Replayability: 9/10Value for Money: 10/10 (Even at full price or on sale like right now as of this writing)Overall: 9.4/10 - Highly recommend this game! Anime fans or not.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												I put in a lot of time with the original PS3 release and thought enough of the game to add it to my library and work my way through it once again on Steam.The art direction is top notch, and the cel shaded look will help to ensure that the visuals stand the test of time.  The soundtrack is solid, while the effects are nice and satisfying.  The story is very straightforward but remains fairly engaging due to an interesting cast of characters.With all that said, the gameplay is the real standout here.  A glorious hybrid of strategy and real time elements makes this game truly unique and engaging.  The top down map view lets you plot your next move and observe friendly and enemy positions, assuming you currently have eyes on them.  Spending CP during you turn will then allow you to either issue orders or jump into the shoes of one of your units on the battlefield.  Once you're directly in control of a soldier or vehicle, you'll be free to move about the field and fire - or be fired upon - in third-person mode until you've exhausted the unit's AP and/or manually end the turn.  The whole thing works beautifully and really opens the door for a wide variety of attack strategies depending on map layout and squad composition.  Sprinkle in some nice leveling and crafting mechanics, and you've got one heck of an SRPG.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 26, 2016
												Background: Played it on the Playstation back in the day and I am delighted to see DLC added.Combat Mechanics: Open Map, Strategic Turn based - Look its hard to describe this one. So you have a number of Action Points per round and each point can control an Infantry unit or 2 points for the Main Tank. There are various classes with set equipment and max movement allotment. Shooting wise, you line up the shots and then the computer takes over dealing with range, accuracy, etc. Line of Sight plays a big part in this game and should be thought about when forming a strategy.Military Downtime: Between your combat sequences there is a Huge amount of Lore behind this game and each character. Snippets of Conversation, movies, pictures all paint a rich detailed world with people who have families, wants and needs. It gives the game a more real feel and makes you care about the characters you control.Final Thoughts: I love a good story. Even though this one is 100% linear and very grindy at times it showcases what developers focused on back in the day. Great Art, good story, and thoughtful mechanics.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 6, 2016
												Valkyria Chronicles is a little gem I never expected would hold my attention so firmly.  The game is effectively a small unit tactical strategy in the same vein as UFO: Enemy Unknown and similar games.  Your units use points to get around and have  one significant action per activation.  People who know this style of game will undestand this mechanic.  However unlike other versions of this mechanic you may activate untils based on Command Points which allows you to activate the same unit several times if needed though each time they have a reduced Action Point pool.The game was ledgendary on Sega and the port is a little clunky but still quite usable.  The biggest frustration is driving the tanks.  The graphics is intended to look like a comic book.  A series of animated sequences in panels.  The game play has the same look but using 3D models with rag doll physics.  So it keeps the feel of a comic book but has more modern engine.The real attraction to this game is the story. Once you get to know the characters you will put hours into the game to follow the story to its conclusion.  In addition, every character and soldier in the game has a back story you unlock during game play.  A single run through the game wont unlock them all so finding about about everyone takes some effort.Overall I think I'll be playing this game through at least two more times.  I will probably come back to it over and over for years to come.  Highly recommended and worth it.
